segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer

segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer

segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points from an App-V 5.1 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package For All Users on a Specific Computer

segment.source: Use the following procedure to revert extension points from an App-V 5.1 package to the App-V 4.6 file format using the deployment configuration file.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to revert extension points from an App-V 5.1 package to the App-V 4.6 file format using the deployment configuration file.

segment.source: To revert a package
segment.target: To revert a package

segment.source: Ensure that App-V 4.6 package is published to the users but the FTAs and shortcuts have been assumed by App-V 5.1 package using the following migration method, How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to a Converted App-V 5.1 Package for All Users on a Specific Computer.
segment.target: Ensure that App-V 4.6 package is published to the users but the FTAs and shortcuts have been assumed by App-V 5.1 package using the following migration method, How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to a Converted App-V 5.1 Package for All Users on a Specific Computer.

segment.source: In the userConfiguration section of the deployment configuration file for the converted package, to set the policy, make the following update to the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="false" PackageName=Package ID
segment.target: In the userConfiguration section of the deployment configuration file for the converted package, to set the policy, make the following update to the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="false" PackageName=Package ID

segment.source: From an elevated command prompt, type:
segment.target: From an elevated command prompt, type:

segment.source: PSSet-AppvClientPackage $pkg –DynamicDeploymentConfigurationpath to deployment configuration file
segment.target: PSSet-AppvClientPackage $pkg –DynamicDeploymentConfigurationpath to deployment configuration file

segment.source: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg –DynamicUserConfigurationType useDeploymentConfiguration
segment.target: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg –DynamicUserConfigurationType useDeploymentConfiguration

segment.source: Perform a publishing refresh, or wait for the next scheduled publishing refresh for the App-V 4.6 package.
segment.target: Perform a publishing refresh, or wait for the next scheduled publishing refresh for the App-V 4.6 package.

segment.source: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts.
segment.target: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts.

segment.source: The Application should now open using App-V 4.6.
segment.target: The Application should now open using App-V 4.6.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you do not need the App-V 5.1 package anymore, you can unpublish the App-V 5.1 package and the extension points will automatically revert to App-V 4.6.
segment.target: If you do not need the App-V 5.1 package anymore, you can unpublish the App-V 5.1 package and the extension points will automatically revert to App-V 4.6.
